links.title: Krita
links.description: Professional free and open-source painting program for digital artists, illustrators, and concept designers.

links.title: GIMP
links.description: The GNU Image Manipulation Program—powerful for photo retouching, image editing, and composition.

links.title: Inkscape
links.description: Free and open-source vector graphics editor for illustrators and designers—ideal for SVG workflows.

links.title: Kdenlive
links.description: A robust, multi-track non-linear video editor that works great on Linux and supports a wide range of codecs and effects.

links.title: Audacity
links.description: Popular multi-track audio editor and recorder used for podcasts, music editing, and voiceovers.

links.title: LMMS
links.description: A free cross-platform music production suite—create beats, synths, and full tracks with MIDI support.

tips.title: Use Flatpak for Creative Apps
tips.content: Creative tools like Krita and Inkscape often ship the latest versions as Flatpaks. They're sandboxed and easy to update.

tips.title: Color Calibrate Your Monitor
tips.content: For accurate digital painting or video editing, use tools like DisplayCAL and a hardware colorimeter.

tips.title: Edit Non-Destructively
tips.content: Use layer-based editing in apps like GIMP and Krita to retain flexibility when creating or retouching images.

tips.title: Try JACK Audio for Pro Audio
tips.content: Use JACK with tools like Ardour or Carla for low-latency, professional-grade Linux audio production setups.

tips.title: Use SVGs for Scalable Artwork
tips.content: Vector formats like SVG are ideal for logos, icons, and UI design. Inkscape is a great choice for editing them.

tips.title: Keep Backups of Your Projects
tips.content: Creative files are often irreplaceable. Use Timeshift, rsync, or cloud backup to keep your work safe.
